title: embedding
description: Embedding of a batch of tokenized data for scGPT zero-shot or fine-tuning integration.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input h5mu file containing preprocessed data
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `input.h5mu`. The input h5mu file containing preprocessed data.

model.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. Path to model file
model.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `best_model.pt`. Path to model file.

model_vocab.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Path to model vocabulary file
model_vocab.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `vocab.json`. Path to model vocabulary file.

model_config.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. Path to model config file
model_config.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `args.json`. Path to model config file.

input_gene_ids.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `gene_ids.pt`. Path to pytorch tensor file containing the gene ids
input_gene_ids.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `gene_ids.pt`. Path to pytorch tensor file containing the gene ids.

input_values.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `values.pt`. Path to pytorch tensor file containing the tokenized values
input_values.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `values.pt`. Path to pytorch tensor file containing the tokenized values.

input_padding_mask.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `padding_mask.pt`. Path to pytorch tensor file containing the padding mask
input_padding_mask.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `padding_mask.pt`. Path to pytorch tensor file containing the padding mask.

gene_name_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `gene_name`. The name of adata
gene_name_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `gene_name`. The name of adata.var column containing gene names.

batch_id_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `batch_id`. The name of the adata
batch_id_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `batch_id`. The name of the adata.obs column containing the batch ids.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5ad`, example: `output.h5ad`. Path to output anndata file containing pre-processed data as well as scGPT embeddings
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5ad`, example: `output.h5ad`. Path to output anndata file containing pre-processed data as well as scGPT embeddings.

output_compression.description: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression algorithm to use for the output h5mu file
output_compression.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gzip`, choices: ``gzip`, `lzf``. The compression algorithm to use for the output h5mu file.

embedding_layer.description: Type: `string`, default: `X_scGPT`. The name of the adata
embedding_layer.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `X_scGPT`. The name of the adata.obsm array to which scGPT embeddings will be written.

pad_token.description: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The name of the layer to be padded and tokenized
pad_token.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `<pad>`. The name of the layer to be padded and tokenized

pad_value.description: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value to be used for padding
pad_value.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `-2`. The value to be used for padding

dropout.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.2`. Dropout value used for the transformer encoder layer
dropout.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.2`. Dropout value used for the transformer encoder layer

DSBN.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization
DSBN.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Apply domain-specific batch normalization

batch_size.description: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for inference
batch_size.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `64`. The batch size to be used for inference

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
